Description: Glazed composition shabti with a striated lappet-wig, a modelled face with a plaited beard, crossed hands in relief holding an adze and a hoe, the waist is inscribed with two rows of worn or softly incised, now illegible, hieroglyphs, the front of the leg section is inscribed with a similar column; there is a back-pillar and a plinth beneath the feet.
Curator's comments: Sir Hans Sloane’s ‘Miscellanea’ catalogue is a bound volume in Central Archives containing seven separate catalogues: ‘Miscellanies’, ‘Antiquities’, ‘Seals’, ‘Pictures’, ‘Mathematical Instruments’, ‘Agate Handles’ and ‘Agate Cups, Bottles, Spoons’. Each contains numbered entries that list and describe objects collected by Sloane between the 1680s and 1750s. Each catalogue begins with object number one. Text from Sloane Miscellanea catalogue: Miscellanea Antiquities 273 "273. A very large Ægyptian idol in blew clay Figlina idola varieæ magnitudinis reperta in mummiarum ventre consuta. Jo: Nard. In Lulcret. p. 654."
